title: I Am Invincible (horse)
text:
I Am Invincible (foaled 2004) is a <a href="Group%20races">stakes</a> winning <a href="Australian">Australian</a> bred thoroughbred racehorse that is most notable for his success as a stallion, having sired more than 60 individual stakes winners. 
Background.
I Am Invincible was purchased at the 2006 <a href="William%20Inglis%20and%20Sons">Inglis</a> NSW Classic Twilight Session by his original trainer Toby Edmonds for owners Ray & Brett Gall for the amount of <a href="A%24">A$</a>62,500.
Racing career.
I Am Invincible won his debut race by five lengths on the 21 February 2007 at <a href="Warwick%20Farm%20Racecourse">Warwick Farm</a>. 
The performance convinced trainer Toby Edmonds to set the horse towards the <a href="Golden%20Slipper%20Stakes">Golden Slipper</a>. He next lined up in the <a href="Kindergarten%20Stakes">Kindergarten Stakes</a>. Drawn near the outside in a field of 14, the horse again showed brilliant speed to cross and sit in second place before finishing a game third to the eventual Golden Slipper winner Forensics.
Injured at his next start when down the track in the <a href="Todman%20Stakes">Todman Stakes</a>, the horse was forced off the scene for a prolonged period. 
He recaptured his best form as a four year-old for Victorian trainer Peter Morgan with brilliant wins in the <a href="D.C.%20McKay%20Stakes">D.C. McKay Stakes</a> at <a href="Morphettville%20Racecourse">Morphettville</a> and the Sir John Monash Stakes at <a href="Caulfield%20Racecourse">Caulfield</a>.
In 2009 he ran a memorable second to <a href="Takeover%20Target">Takeover Target</a> in <a href="The%20Goodwood">The Goodwood</a>. Jockey <a href="Darren%20Gauci">Darren Gauci</a> took him to the lead and kicked clear rounding the turn, however he was overtaken late to be beaten a length.
Stud career.
I Am Invincible was retired from racing to stand at Yarraman Park Stud in <a href="Scone%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Scone, New South Wales</a>. His initial service fee was $11,000. This increased to $247,500 in 2019, making him the most expensive stallion in Australia. He has recently serviced two of Australia's greatest horses, <a href="Winx%20%28horse%29">Winx</a> and <a href="Black%20Caviar">Black Caviar</a>.
Notable Progeny.
I Am Invincible has currently sired 10 individual <a href="Group%20One">Group 1</a> winners:
'c = <a href="colt%20%28horse%29">colt</a>, f = <a href="filly">filly</a>", g = <a href="gelding">gelding</a>"
